event.title: Space Camp Bachelorette
event.location: U.S. Space & Rocket Center, Huntsville, AL

spaceCamp.about: Spend a weekend training as an astronaut. The Adult Space Academy is a 3-day, 2-night immersive program for adults (18+) at the U.S. Space & Rocket Center in Huntsville, Alabama. You'll assume real astronaut roles, complete hands-on space missions, and graduate with your astronaut certificate.

schedule.note: Graduation concludes camp on Sunday, allowing you to explore the Rocket Center at your own pace.

included: All meals from Friday dinner through Sunday breakfast

spaceCampTuition.description: Adult Space Academy tuition per person (includes 2 nights accommodations and all meals)

additionalCosts.notes: Round-trip flights, rental car, or driving costs
Downtown Huntsville exploring, restaurants beyond Space Camp meals, breweries, museums
Mission patches, photos, space memorabilia from gift shop

essentials: Closed-toe athletic shoes (required for all training activities)
ID or driver's license (needed for check-in)
Layers - indoor facilities can be cool
optional: Space-themed outfit or accessories for fun photos
Notebook and pen for mission notes

recommendations.title: The Martian
recommendations.author: Andy Weir
recommendations.why: Stranded on Mars with science and humor. Great in both formats.

recommendations.title: Arrival
recommendations.author: Denis Villeneuve (Director)
recommendations.why: Stunning sci-fi about communication with aliens

recommendations.title: The Expanse
recommendations.author: James S. A. Corey
recommendations.why: Epic space opera set across the solar system

recommendations.title: Three Body Problem
recommendations.author: Liu Cixin
recommendations.why: Mind-bending first contact hard sci-fi. Both the book and Netflix series are worth your time.

recommendations.title: Project Hail Mary
recommendations.author: Andy Weir
recommendations.why: A lone astronaut on a mission to save humanity. From the author of The Martian, with the same wit and hard science.
